sourceMeaningMnemonic: Take a <radical>mole</radical> out of its <radical>hole</radical> and it will <kanji>suffocate</kanji>. They need to be in tight quarters, unlike us humans. So when you take one out of its nice, safe hole, it thinks it can't breathe and suffocates.
meaningInfo: Picture a poor little mole suffocating in your hand after you took it out of its hole. Put it back right away! Don't kill that little mole!
readingMnemonic: As the mole <kanji>suffocate</kanji>s it <reading>cheats</reading> (<ja>ちつ</ja>) and shoves its head into your closed hand. You realize what it's doing and squeeze your hand tighter so it's more like a hole. You can feel the mole breathing again now.
readingInfo: Unfortunately, you can't use cheats on life, and the mole suddenly stiffens and suffocates to death anyway. You should feel bad about what you've done.
